intro: Adenocalymma microcarpum, commonly known as the small-fruited adenocalymma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its small, woody fruits and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellow, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Adenocalymma microcarpum is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
